greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Concatenate prime factorization written in base 3, convert back to decimal.
comment: A080670 is the base 10 version, A230625 is the binary version.
link: Michael De Vlieger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: Table[FromDigits[#, 3] &@ Flatten@ Map[IntegerDigits[#, 3] &, FactorInteger[n] /. {p_, e_} /; p > 0 :> If[e == 1, p, {p, e}]], {n, 64}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Jul 29 2017 *)
program: (PARI) a(n) = {if (n==1, return(1)); f = factor(n); s = []; for (i=1, #f~, s = concat(s, digits(f[i, 1], 3)); if (f[i, 2] != 1, s = concat(s, digits(f[i, 2], 3))););  fromdigits(s, 3);} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Jul 27 2017
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jul 27 2017
